alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Sherman; Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 16 at 10:10AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: .Widespread shower and thunderstorm activity is expected this afternoon and evening across eastern Colorado and northwestern Kansas. This flood watch for flash flooding has been issued to cover this heavy rainfall threat for locations that have received heavy rainfall in recent days. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central Colorado and Kansas, including the following counties, in east central Colorado, Cheyenne and Kit Carson. In Kansas, Greeley, Sherman and Wallace. * WHEN...This afternoon and evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Slow moving storms are expected to develop along the Colorado Front Range this afternoon and move eastward into portions of Eastern-Central Colorado and Northwestern Kansas going into the evening hours. Heavy rainfall is possible with these storms which could cause flash flooding to occur. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
